class_description:
NSUnarchiver, a concrete subclass of NSCoder, defines methods for decoding a set of Objective-C objects from an archive. Such archives are produced by objects of the NSArchiver class.
In macOS 10.2 and later, NSArchiver and NSUnarchiver have been replaced by NSKeyedArchiver and NSKeyedUnarchiver respectively—see Archives and Serializations Programming Guide.

return_description: An NSUnarchiver object initialized to read an archive from data. Returns nil if data is not a valid archive.

Methods.method_description: Returns an NSUnarchiver object initialized to read an archive from a given data object.

params.param_description: An NSData object that contains an archive created using NSArchiver.

return_description: The object, or object graph, that was archived in data. Returns nil if data cannot be unarchived.

Methods.method_description: Decodes and returns the object archived in a given NSData object.
Methods.method_declar: class func unarchiveObject(with data: Data) -> Any?

params.param_description: The path to a file than contains an archive created using NSArchiver.

return_description: The object, or object graph, that was archived in the file at path. Returns nil if the file at path cannot be unarchived.

Methods.method_description: Decodes and returns the object archived in the file path.
Methods.method_declar: class func unarchiveObject(withFile path: String) -> Any?

return_description: The name of the class used when instantiating objects whose ostensible class, according to the archived data, is nameInArchive. Returns nameInArchive if no substitute name has been specified using the class method (not the instance method) decodeClassName(_:asClassName:).

Methods.method_description: Returns the name of the class used when instantiating objects whose ostensible class, according to the archived data, is a given name.
Methods.method_declar: class func classNameDecoded(forArchiveClassName inArchiveName: String) -> String

params.param_description: The name of the class to use when instantiating objects whose ostensible class, according to the archived data, is nameInArchive.

Methods.method_description: Instructs instances of NSUnarchiver to use the class with a given name when instantiating objects whose ostensible class, according to the archived data, is another given name.
Methods.method_declar: class func decodeClassName(_ inArchiveName: String, asClassName trueName: String)

return_description: The name of the class that will be used when instantiating objects whose ostensible class, according to the archived data, is nameInArchive. Returns nameInArchive unless a substitute name has been specified using the instance method (not the class method) decodeClassName(_:asClassName:).

Methods.method_description: Returns the name of the class that will be used when instantiating objects whose ostensible class, according to the archived data, is a given name.

params.param_description: The name of the class to use when instantiating objects whose ostensible class, according to the archived data, is nameInArchive.

Methods.method_description: Instructs the receiver to use the class with a given name when instantiating objects whose ostensible class, according to the archived data, is another given name.
Methods.method_declar: func decodeClassName(_ inArchiveName: String, asClassName trueName: String)

params.param_description: The object with which to replace object.

Methods.method_description: Causes the receiver to substitute one given object for another whenever the latter is extracted from the archive.
Methods.method_declar: func replace(_ object: Any, with newObject: Any)

Vars.var_description: A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver has reached the end of the encoded data while decoding.
The system version number in effect when the archive was created.
